p: In this study, we investigated the spatial and temporal patterns of human's mobility to public parks and open spaces in the western and central US, where COVID‐19 and wildfire co‐occurred in June–September 2020. Specifically, we employed the GTWR models to examine how different factors, including the COVID‐19 outbreaks, wildfires, air quality, and drought, drove the following three metrics that describe human recreation and mobility at public parks: (a) the number of visits per capita, (b) the median of minimum dwell time they spent at the park, and (c) the median travel distance to parks.
